content:
So -- it seems like we're having problems moving FCPs along. =) e.g., the following charters have been stalled out for some time:

  • rust-lang/lang-team#43 -- align(ptr)
  • rust-lang/lang-team#45 -- declarative macro rep counts

I'm wondering if we want to find another process here, such as using a synchronous meeting to process pending charters or other similar decisions?
I'm not sure it helps to use a synchronous meeting; that mostly just serves the same purpose as @ ing the people at the meeting and saying "hey, can you check a box here". :)
And it only pokes the people who are at the meeting. :)
The idea would be that attendance at the meeting is mandatory if you want a say :)
An alternative would be to use more of a "Seconding" mechanism
Another alternative would be for folks to check their boxes more quickly :)

the main reason I was considering a meeting as a possibility though was that it may be useful to have dedicated time to do "planning of the things we'll be focusing on", and to be able to consider the choice more holistically, than "do I approve this particular proposal"
To that end: ping @Taylor Cramer, @pnkfelix and @boats, who have not checked boxes on the above :)
Seconding and time for objections seems reasonable to me.
While I'm pinging folks, @Josh Triplett @Taylor Cramer @pnkfelix and @boats maybe take a look at https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/74160
Done.
Done

Related: I have a hard time keeping up with GH notifications sometimes, and I was relying on rusty-dash to tell me about FCP checkboxes. It seems that site doesn't exist anymore-- is there a replacement I can / should look into?
https://rfcbot.rs/ has a list of RFCs, not sure about FCPs
ok yeah FCPs too
/me nods
I use rfcbot.rs for that as well; I think that's the most up-to-date location.
